meanings.definition: A person who studies the chemical processes and substances that occur within living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Biochemists conduct experiments to understand how chemicals work in living things.
meanings.sent2: The biochemists at the lab are researching new ways to treat diseases.
meanings.sent3: The biochemists accidentally mixed up the solutions and created a colorful explosion.
meanings.sent4: In the world of biology, biochemists are the detectives uncovering the mysteries of life.
meanings.sent5: The biochemists' lab was filled with bubbling test tubes and the smell of various chemicals.

meanings.definition: The group of individuals who specialize in the field of biochemistry.
meanings.sent1: Biochemists from different universities gathered for a conference on the latest research.
meanings.sent2: The biochemists collaborated on a project to develop a new type of fertilizer.
meanings.sent3: At the biochemists' party, everyone brought dishes made with organic ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The biochemists in the department formed a tight-knit community of researchers.
meanings.sent5: The biochemists' dedication to their work inspired the younger scientists in the field.
